\(\theta_{\mathrm{R}} =\) ........................................................ <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 428, 181, 447]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 428, 541, 447]]<|/det|> Pour \(150 \text{cm}^3\) of hot water into the beaker. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 444, 601, 463]]<|/det|> Place the thermometer in the water in the beaker. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 476, 920, 510]]<|/det|> In the first row of Table 2.1, record the temperature \(\theta\) of the water at time \(t = 0\) and immediately start the stop-clock. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 522, 920, 556]]<|/det|> In Table 2.1, record the temperature \(\theta\) of the water at times \(t = 30 \text{s}, 60 \text{s}, 90 \text{s}, 120 \text{s}, 150 \text{s}, 180 \text{s}, 210 \text{s}, 240 \text{s}\) and \(270 \text{s}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 545, 920, 564]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 570, 148, 588]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 570, 450, 588]]<|/det|> Complete the headings in Table 2.1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 570, 920, 588]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 600, 541, 618]]<|/det|> Table 2.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 626, 636, 902]]<|/det|>

<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Calculate the average cooling rate \(x_{1}\) during the first 90 s of the experiment. Use your readings from Table 2.1 and the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 120, 556, 149]]<|/det|>
\[x_{1} = \frac{\theta_{0} - \theta_{90}}{T}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 157, 787, 177]]<|/det|>
where \(T = 90 \text{s}\) and \(\theta_0\) and \(\theta_{90}\) are the temperatures at \(t = 0\) and \(t = 90 \text{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 173, 487, 192]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[520, 234, 920, 253]]<|/det|>
